text: Soanda (), or Soandum or Soandon (Σόανδον), was a fortified settlement of ancient Cappadocia, inhabited in Roman times.Antonine Itinerary p. 202. The same place seems to be alluded to by Frontinus, who calls it Suenda.Frontinus, Strategemata, 3.2.9. Its site is tentatively located near Kuşaklı Hüyük, Asiatic Turkey. ==References== Category:Populated places in ancient Cappadocia Category:Former populated places in Turkey Category:Roman towns and cities in Turkey Category:Populated places of the Byzantine Empire Category:History of Kırşehir Province
title: Soanda
